Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend "The Passion of the Christ" (2004) directed by Mel Gibson and starring Richard Burton, Tom Cruise, and other famous actors.

"The Passion of the Christ" is based on the Gospel according to Matthew chapter 16-28. It tells the story of Jesus of Nazareth, the Son of God, who was crucified and died in Jerusalem on the day of Passover, but was raised from the dead three days later, and appeared to many people before finally ascending into Heaven.

The film received widespread critical acclaim upon its release in 2004. It won four Academy Awards including Best Picture, Best Director (Mel Gibson), Best Adapted Screenplay (Richard Stanley) and Best Supporting Actor (Tom Cruise).

Additionally, the film also won an Empire Award for Best British Film, a Golden Globe for Best Motion Picture - Drama and another Golden Globe for Best Director (Mel Gibson).
